subject: Re: [junit] Re: Test Names for Parameterized Tests (was: TestNG 4 and Data Providers)
msgSnippet: ... There is no run() on a test class. You mean it invokes run() on the TestRunner, which in turn recreates the test class and invokes the test method on it...

On 10/18/05, Robert Watkins <yahoo@...> wrote:
>
> On 10/19/05, C=
=C3=A9dric Beust =E2=99=94 <cbeust@...> wrote:
> > > It's not hard t=
o do if you keep the test instance in JUnit. You simply
> > > tell it to ru=
n again. With TestNG, you need to reconstruct the test.
> >
> > JUnit will =
also reconstruct the test, not sure what you are getting at?
>
> Cedric, it=
 does not recreate the test instance... it simply calls the
> run() method =
on the instance it already has.


There is no run() on a test class.

You m=
ean it invokes run() on the TestRunner, which in turn recreates the
test cl=
ass and invokes the test method on it...

Which is exactly what TestNG does=
.
